title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, objectives, and requirements for the SpaceDebrisTracker system.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall architecture of the SpaceDebrisTracker system, including components, data flow, integration points, and key considerations such as scalability, fault tolerance, security, and compatibility with future extensions and upgrades. The design should follow best practices in software engineering and include a clear roadmap for implementation, testing, and deployment. This task requires understanding of space debris tracking, satellite systems, and data analysis.

title: Data Acquisition and Processing
description: Develop methods for acquiring and processing data on space debris from various sources.

title: Debris Tracking and Prediction
description: Implement algorithms and models for tracking and predicting the movement of space debris.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement a robust, scalable database to store and manage space debris data, ensuring high availability and performance. The database should handle large amounts of data related to the debris objects (size, mass, material, orbit parameters, etc.), their current and predicted trajectories, potential collision risks with operational satellites or spacecraft, and any relevant metadata or historical data. Additionally, consider implementing indexing strategies for efficient query performance. Also, ensure that the database design is flexible to accommodate future changes and growth of the system. Further, document the database schema and provide a brief explanation of how it meets the project's requirements.

title: User Interface Development
description: Develop a user interface for visualizing and interacting with space debris data and predictions.

title: Security and Access Control: SpaceDebrisTracker System
description: Implement robust security measures and access control mechanisms for the SpaceDebrisTracker system. Ensure data integrity, confidentiality, and protection against unauthorized access. Incorporate best practices for role-based access control (RBAC) and identity and access management (IAM). Utilize modern encryption techniques to secure sensitive data such as encryption methods to be used (e.g., AES, RSA), key management strategies, and secure storage of cryptographic keys. Update the documentation with security policies and guidelines for developers, including a detailed explanation of RBAC, IAM, and best practices for implementing them. Perform regular security audits and penetration testing to identify potential vulnerabilities and address them promptly.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and implement test plans and quality assurance processes for the SpaceDebrisTracker system.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure and DevOps processes for the SpaceDebrisTracker system. This includes CI/CD pipelines, version control (using GitHub), automated testing, containerization (with Docker), cloud deployment (on AWS), and configuration management. Consider implementing a hybrid approach with Jenkins for CI/CD and CircleCI for continuous testing. It would also be beneficial to incorporate automated security checks and code quality analysis using tools like SonarQube or Black Duck. Lastly, ensure that the infrastructure is scalable and can handle large amounts of data associated with space debris tracking.

title: Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation and user guides for the SpaceDebrisTracker system.
